description.narrative: The Cambodian Center for Human Rights (CCHR) is a non-government organization that works to promote and protect democracy and respect for human rights – primarily civil and political rights. It was found in 2002. CCHR focuses on protecting fundamental freedoms; judicial and legislative reform; equality and discrimination; business and human rights. Since 2013 there is increasingly unhumane abuse of power and suppression of public and personal freedoms, and land acitivists, human rights defenders and opposition leaders and members at all level have been detained, arrested and sentenced through manipulateion of the judicial system. The passed Telecommunications Law, LANGO Law, the Trade Union Law threaten to restrict further freedoms of expression and association. CCHR’s objectives are to provide a principled voice on human rights, raise awareness of human rights abuses and deter human rights abusers, advocate for the full spectrum of fundamental civil and political rights in Cambodia, defend all fundamental freedoms, strengthen the rule of law, promote democracy and full political participation, particularly by women and youth. The expected outcomes are summaried as the following: Cultural context-related justifications for human rights violations of any kind are minimized, Cambodian activists, Human Right Defenders and at-risk communities are equipped with the tools to protect and defend their human rights. The Cambodia government, local authorities, and businesses engage with civil society and increased their respect for human rights. The main activities are documentation of human rights violations, increase awareness of the human rights, engage the business sector and national government to increase respect for human rights, campaign for the release of activists, provide legal support to LGBT victims of discrimination and conduct legislative and judicial analyses. The target group of CCHR is the Cambodian people nationwide.
This project mainly contributes to results within Fulfilment of human rights commitments. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
